properties.name: quarkus.datasource.driver
properties.description: The datasource driver class name

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.xa
properties.description:
Whether we want to use XA.

If used, the driver has to support it.

properties.description: The datasource driver class name

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.{*}.xa
properties.description:
Whether we want to use XA.

If used, the driver has to support it.

properties.description: The datasource URL

properties.description: The datasource pool minimum size

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.max-size

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.background-validation-interval
properties.description: The interval at which we validate idle connections in the background

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.acquisition-timeout

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.idle-removal-interval

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.{*}.enable-metrics
properties.description: Enable datasource metrics collection.

properties.name: quarkus.arc.remove-unused-beans
properties.description:
If set to all (or true) the container will attempt to remove all unused beans.

An unused bean:

  • is not a built-in bean or interceptor,
  • is not eligible for injection to any injection point,
  • is not excluded by any extension,
  • does not have a name,
  • does not declare an observer,
  • does not declare any producer which is eligible for injection to any injection point,
  • is not directly eligible for injection into any {@link javax.enterprise.inject.Instance} injection point
If set to none (or false) no beans will ever be removed even if they are unused (according to the criteria set out above) If set to fwk, then all unused beans will be removed, except the unused beans whose classes are declared in the application code @see UnremovableBeanBuildItem

properties.name: quarkus.arc.auto-inject-fields
properties.description:
If set to true {@code @Inject} is automatically added to all non-static fields that are annotated with
 one of the annotations defined by {@link AutoInjectAnnotationBuildItem}.

properties.name: quarkus.application.name
properties.description:
The name of the application.
 If not set, defaults to the name of the project.

properties.name: quarkus.application.version
properties.description:
The version of the application.
 If not set, defaults to the version of the project

properties.name: quarkus.jni.library-paths
properties.description: Paths of library to load.

properties.name: quarkus.jni.enable
properties.description: Enable JNI support.

properties.name: quarkus.ssl.native
properties.description: Enable native SSL support.

properties.name: quarkus.index-dependency.{*}.group-id
properties.description: The maven groupId of the artifact to index

properties.name: quarkus.index-dependency.{*}.artifact-id
properties.description: The maven artifactId of the artifact to index

properties.name: quarkus.index-dependency.{*}.classifier
properties.description: The maven classifier of the artifact to index

properties.name: quarkus.thread-pool.core-threads
properties.description: The core thread pool size. This number of threads will always be kept alive.

properties.name: quarkus.thread-pool.max-threads
properties.description:
The maximum number of threads. If this is not specified then
 it will be automatically sized to 8 * the number of available processors

properties.name: quarkus.thread-pool.queue-size
properties.description: The queue size. For most applications this should be unbounded

properties.name: quarkus.thread-pool.growth-resistance
properties.description:
The executor growth resistance.

 A resistance factor applied after the core pool is full; values applied here will cause that fraction
 of submissions to create new threads when no idle thread is available. A value of {@code 0.0f} implies that
 threads beyond the core size should be created as aggressively as threads within it; a value of {@code 1.0f}
 implies that threads beyond the core size should never be created.

properties.name: quarkus.thread-pool.shutdown-timeout
properties.description:
The shutdown timeout. If all pending work has not been completed by this time
 then additional threads will be spawned to attempt to finish any pending tasks, and the shutdown process will
 continue

properties.name: quarkus.thread-pool.shutdown-interrupt
properties.description:
The amount of time to wait for thread pool shutdown before tasks should be interrupted. If this value is
 greater than or equal to the value for {@link #shutdownTimeout}, then tasks will not be interrupted before
 the shutdown timeout occurs.

properties.name: quarkus.thread-pool.shutdown-check-interval
properties.description:
The frequency at which the status of the thread pool should be checked during shutdown. Information about
 waiting tasks and threads will be checked and possibly logged at this interval. Setting this key to an empty
 value disables the shutdown check interval.

properties.name: quarkus.thread-pool.keep-alive-time
properties.description: The amount of time a thread will stay alive with no work.

properties.name: quarkus.log.category.{*}.min-level
properties.description: The minimum level that this category can be set to

properties.name: quarkus.log.category.{*}.level
properties.description: The log level level for this category

properties.name: quarkus.log.filter.{*}.if-starts-with
properties.description: The message starts to match

properties.name: quarkus.log.level
properties.description: The default log level

properties.name: quarkus.log.min-level
properties.description: The default minimum log level

properties.name: quarkus.log.console.enable
properties.description: If console logging should be enabled

properties.name: quarkus.log.console.format
properties.description: The log format

properties.name: quarkus.log.console.level
properties.description: The console log level

properties.name: quarkus.log.console.color
properties.description: If the console logging should be in color

properties.name: quarkus.log.console.darken
properties.description: Specify how much the colors should be darkened

properties.name: quarkus.log.console.async
properties.description: Indicates whether to log asynchronously

properties.name: quarkus.log.console.async.queue-length
properties.description: The queue length to use before flushing writing

properties.name: quarkus.log.console.async.overflow
properties.description: Determine whether to block the publisher (rather than drop the message) when the queue is full

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.enable
properties.description: If file logging should be enabled

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.format
properties.description: The log format

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.level
properties.description: The level of logs to be written into the file.

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.path
properties.description: The name of the file in which logs will be written.

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.async
properties.description: Indicates whether to log asynchronously

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.async.queue-length
properties.description: The queue length to use before flushing writing

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.async.overflow
properties.description: Determine whether to block the publisher (rather than drop the message) when the queue is full

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.rotation.max-file-size
properties.description: The maximum file size of the log file after which a rotation is executed.

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.rotation.max-backup-index
properties.description: The maximum number of backups to keep.

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.rotation.file-suffix
properties.description:
File handler rotation file suffix.

 Example fileSuffix: .yyyy-MM-dd

properties.name: quarkus.log.file.rotation.rotate-on-boot
properties.description: Indicates whether to rotate log files on server initialization.

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.enable
properties.description: If syslog logging should be enabled

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.endpoint
properties.description: The IP address and port of the syslog server

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.app-name
properties.description: The app name used when formatting the message in RFC5424 format

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.hostname
properties.description: The name of the host the messages are being sent from

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.facility
properties.description: Sets the facility used when calculating the priority of the message as defined by RFC-5424 and RFC-3164

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.syslog-type
properties.description: Set the {@link SyslogType syslog type} this handler should use to format the message sent

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.protocol
properties.description: Sets the protocol used to connect to the syslog server

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.use-counting-framing
properties.description: Set to {@code true} if the message being sent should be prefixed with the size of the message

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.truncate
properties.description: Set to {@code true} if the message should be truncated

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.block-on-reconnect
properties.description:
Enables or disables blocking when attempting to reconnect a
 {@link org.jboss.logmanager.handlers.SyslogHandler.Protocol#TCP
 TCP} or {@link org.jboss.logmanager.handlers.SyslogHandler.Protocol#SSL_TCP SSL TCP} protocol

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.format
properties.description: The log message format

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.level
properties.description: The log level specifying, which message levels will be logged by syslog logger

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.async
properties.description: Indicates whether to log asynchronously

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.async.queue-length
properties.description: The queue length to use before flushing writing

properties.name: quarkus.log.syslog.async.overflow
properties.description: Determine whether to block the publisher (rather than drop the message) when the queue is full

properties.name: quarkus.oauth2.enabled
properties.description: If the OAuth2 extension is enabled.

properties.name: quarkus.oauth2.client-id
properties.description: The identifier of the client on the OAuth2 Authorization Server

properties.name: quarkus.oauth2.client-secret
properties.description: The secret of the client

properties.name: quarkus.oauth2.introspection-url
properties.description: The URL of token introspection endpoint

properties.name: quarkus.oauth2.ca-cert-file
properties.description:
The path to a custom cert file
 This is not supported in native mode

properties.name: quarkus.oauth2.role-claim
properties.description: The claim that provides the roles

properties.name: quarkus.security.file.auth-mechanism
properties.description: The authentication mechanism

properties.name: quarkus.security.file.realm-name
properties.description: The authentication mechanism

properties.name: quarkus.security.file.enabled
properties.description: If the properties store is enabled.

properties.name: quarkus.security.file.users
properties.description: The location of the users property resource

properties.name: quarkus.security.file.roles
properties.description: The location of the roles property file

properties.name: quarkus.security.embedded.auth-mechanism
properties.description: The authentication mechanism

properties.name: quarkus.security.embedded.realm-name
properties.description: The authentication mechanism

properties.name: quarkus.security.embedded.enabled
properties.description: If the embedded store is enabled.

properties.name: quarkus.security.embedded.users.{*}
properties.description: The realm users user1=password\nuser2=password2... mapping

properties.name: quarkus.security.embedded.roles.{*}
properties.description: The realm roles user1=role1,role2,...\nuser2=role1,role2,... mapping

properties.name: quarkus.security.security-providers
properties.description: List of security providers to enable for reflection

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.locations
properties.description:
Comma-separated list of locations to scan recursively for migrations. The location type is determined by its prefix.
 Unprefixed locations or locations starting with classpath: point to a package on the classpath and may contain both SQL
 and Java-based migrations.
 Locations starting with filesystem: point to a directory on the filesystem, may only contain SQL migrations and are only
 scanned recursively down non-hidden directories.

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.connect-retries
properties.description:
The maximum number of retries when attempting to connect to the database. After each failed attempt, Flyway will wait 1
 second before attempting to connect again, up to the maximum number of times specified by connectRetries.

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.schemas
properties.description:
Comma-separated case-sensitive list of schemas managed by Flyway.
 The first schema in the list will be automatically set as the default one during the migration.
 It will also be the one containing the schema history table.

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.table
properties.description:
The name of Flyway's schema history table.
 By default (single-schema mode) the schema history table is placed in the default schema for the connection provided by
 the datasource.
 When the flyway.schemas property is set (multi-schema mode), the schema history table is placed in the first schema of
 the list.

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.sql-migration-prefix
properties.description:
The file name prefix for versioned SQL migrations.

 Versioned SQL migrations have the following file name structure: prefixVERSIONseparatorDESCRIPTIONsuffix , which using
 the defaults translates to V1.1__My_description.sql

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.repeatable-sql-migration-prefix
properties.description:
The file name prefix for repeatable SQL migrations.

 Repeatable SQL migrations have the following file name structure: prefixSeparatorDESCRIPTIONsuffix , which using the
 defaults translates to R__My_description.sql

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.baseline-on-migrate
properties.description: Enable the creation of the history table if it does not exist already.

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.baseline-version
properties.description: The initial baseline version.

properties.name: quarkus.flyway.baseline-description
properties.description: The description to tag an existing schema with when executing baseline.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.dialect
properties.description: The hibernate ORM dialect class name

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.dialect.storage-engine
properties.description:
The storage engine used by the dialect if it supports several storage engines.

This is the case of MariaDB.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.sql-load-script
properties.description:
To populate the database tables with data before the application loads,
 specify the location of a load script.
 The location specified in this property is relative to the root of the persistence unit.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.batch-fetch-size
properties.description:
The size of a batch when using batch loading to load entities and collections.

-1 means batch loading is disabled.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.query.query-plan-cache-max-size
properties.description: The max size of the query plan cache.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.query.default-null-ordering
properties.description:
The default ordering of nulls specific in the ORDER BY clause.

Valid values are: none, first, last.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation
properties.description:
Control how schema generation is happening in Hibernate ORM.

Same as JPA's javax.persistence.schema-generation.database.action.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation.halt-on-error
properties.description: Whether we should stop schema application at the first error or continue.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.default-catalog
properties.description: The default database catalog.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.default-schema
properties.description: The default database schema.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.charset
properties.description: The charset of the database.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.jdbc.timezone
properties.description: The timezone pushed to the JDBC driver.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.jdbc.statement-fetch-size
properties.description: How many rows are fetched at a time by the JDBC driver.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.jdbc.statement-batch-size
properties.description: The number of updates (inserts, updates and deletes) that are sent to the database at one time for execution.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.log.sql
properties.description:
Whether we log all the SQL queries executed.

Setting it to true is obviously not recommended in production.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.log.jdbc-warnings
properties.description:
Whether JDBC warnings should be collected and logged.

Default value depends on the dialect.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.cache.{*}.expiration.max-idle
properties.description: The maximum time before an object is considered expired.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.cache.{*}.memory.object-count
properties.description: The maximum number of objects kept in memory.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-orm.statistics
properties.description: Statistics configuration.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.version
properties.description:
The version of Elasticsearch used in the cluster.

As the schema is generated without a connection to the server, this item is mandatory.

It doesn't have to be the exact version (it can be 7 or 7.1 for instance) but it has to be sufficiently precise to choose a model dialect (the one used to generate the schema) compatible with the protocol dialect (the one used to communicate with Elasticsearch).

There's no rule of thumb here as it depends on the schema incompatibilities introduced by Elasticsearch versions. In any case, if there is a problem, you will have an error when Hibernate Search tries to connect to the cluster.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.analysis-configurer
properties.description: The class or the name of the bean used to configure full text analysis (e.g. analyzers, normalizers).

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.version
properties.description:
The version of Elasticsearch used in the cluster.

As the schema is generated without a connection to the server, this item is mandatory.

It doesn't have to be the exact version (it can be 7 or 7.1 for instance) but it has to be sufficiently precise to choose a model dialect (the one used to generate the schema) compatible with the protocol dialect (the one used to communicate with Elasticsearch).

There's no rule of thumb here as it depends on the schema incompatibilities introduced by Elasticsearch versions. In any case, if there is a problem, you will have an error when Hibernate Search tries to connect to the cluster.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.analysis-configurer
properties.description: The class or the name of the bean used to configure full text analysis (e.g. analyzers, normalizers).

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.hosts
properties.description: The list of hosts of the Elasticsearch servers.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.username
properties.description: The username used for authentication.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.password
properties.description: The password used for authentication.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.connection-timeout
properties.description: The connection timeout.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.max-connections
properties.description: The maximum number of connections to all the Elasticsearch servers.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.max-connections-per-route
properties.description: The maximum number of connections per Elasticsearch server.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.discovery.enabled
properties.description: Defines if automatic discovery is enabled.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.index-defaults.lifecycle.strategy
properties.description:
The strategy used for index lifecycle.

Must be one of: none, validate, update, create, drop-and-create or drop-and-create-and-drop.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.index-defaults.lifecycle.required-status
properties.description:
The minimal cluster status required.

Must be one of: green, yellow, red.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.index-defaults.lifecycle.required-status-wait-timeout
properties.description: How long we should wait for the status before failing the bootstrap.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.index-defaults.refresh-after-write
properties.description: Defines if the indexes should be refreshed after writes.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.indexes.{*}.lifecycle.strategy
properties.description:
The strategy used for index lifecycle.

Must be one of: none, validate, update, create, drop-and-create or drop-and-create-and-drop.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.indexes.{*}.lifecycle.required-status
properties.description:
The minimal cluster status required.

Must be one of: green, yellow, red.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.indexes.{*}.lifecycle.required-status-wait-timeout
properties.description: How long we should wait for the status before failing the bootstrap.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.indexes.{*}.refresh-after-write
properties.description: Defines if the indexes should be refreshed after writes.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.hosts
properties.description: The list of hosts of the Elasticsearch servers.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.username
properties.description: The username used for authentication.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.password
properties.description: The password used for authentication.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.connection-timeout
properties.description: The connection timeout.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.max-connections
properties.description: The maximum number of connections to all the Elasticsearch servers.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.max-connections-per-route
properties.description: The maximum number of connections per Elasticsearch server.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.discovery.enabled
properties.description: Defines if automatic discovery is enabled.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.index-defaults.lifecycle.strategy
properties.description:
The strategy used for index lifecycle.

Must be one of: none, validate, update, create, drop-and-create or drop-and-create-and-drop.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.index-defaults.lifecycle.required-status
properties.description:
The minimal cluster status required.

Must be one of: green, yellow, red.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.index-defaults.lifecycle.required-status-wait-timeout
properties.description: How long we should wait for the status before failing the bootstrap.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.index-defaults.refresh-after-write
properties.description: Defines if the indexes should be refreshed after writes.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.indexes.{*}.lifecycle.strategy
properties.description:
The strategy used for index lifecycle.

Must be one of: none, validate, update, create, drop-and-create or drop-and-create-and-drop.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.indexes.{*}.lifecycle.required-status
properties.description:
The minimal cluster status required.

Must be one of: green, yellow, red.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.indexes.{*}.lifecycle.required-status-wait-timeout
properties.description: How long we should wait for the status before failing the bootstrap.

properties.name: quarkus.hibernate-search.elasticsearch.backends.{*}.indexes.{*}.refresh-after-write
properties.description: Defines if the indexes should be refreshed after writes.

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.endpoint
properties.description:
The traces endpoint, in case the client should connect directly to the Collector,
 like http://jaeger-collector:14268/api/traces

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.auth-token
properties.description: Authentication Token to send as "Bearer" to the endpoint

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.user
properties.description: Username to send as part of "Basic" authentication to the endpoint

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.password
properties.description: Password to send as part of "Basic" authentication to the endpoint

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.agent-host-port
properties.description: The hostname and port for communicating with agent via UDP

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.reporter-log-spans
properties.description: Whether the reporter should also log the spans

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.reporter-max-queue-size
properties.description: The reporter's maximum queue size

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.reporter-flush-interval
properties.description: The reporter's flush interval

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.sampler-type
properties.description: The sampler type (const, probabilistic, ratelimiting or remote)

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.sampler-param
properties.description: The sampler parameter (number)

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.sampler-manager-host-port
properties.description: The host name and port when using the remote controlled sampler

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.service-name
properties.description: The service name

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.tags
properties.description:
A comma separated list of name = value tracer level tags, which get added to all reported
 spans. The value can also refer to an environment variable using the format ${envVarName:default},
 where the :default is optional, and identifies a value to be used if the environment variable
 cannot be found

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.propagation
properties.description:
Comma separated list of formats to use for propagating the trace context. Defaults to the
 standard Jaeger format. Valid values are jaeger and b3

properties.name: quarkus.jaeger.sender-factory
properties.description: The sender factory class name

properties.name: quarkus.infinispan-client.near-cache-max-entries
properties.description: Sets the bounded entry count for near cache. If this value is 0 or less near cache is disabled.

properties.name: quarkus.infinispan-client.server-list
properties.description: Sets the host name/port to connect to. Each one is separated by a semicolon (eg. host1:11222;host2:11222).

properties.name: quarkus.kafka-streams.application-id
properties.description: A unique identifier for this Kafka Streams application.

properties.name: quarkus.kafka-streams.bootstrap-servers
properties.description: A comma-separated list of host:port pairs identifying the Kafka bootstrap server(s)

properties.name: quarkus.kafka-streams.application-server
properties.description: A unique identifier of this application instance, typically in the form host:port.

properties.name: quarkus.kafka-streams.topics
properties.description:
A comma-separated list of topic names processed by this stream processing application.
 The pipeline will only be started once all these topics are present in the Kafka cluster.

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.realm
properties.description: Name of the realm.

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.realm-public-key
properties.description: Name of the realm.

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.resource
properties.description: The client-id of the application. Each application has a client-id that is used to identify the application

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.auth-server-url
properties.description:
The base URL of the Keycloak server. All other Keycloak pages and REST service endpoints are derived from this.
 It is usually of the form https://host:port/auth

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.ssl-required
properties.description:
Ensures that all communication to and from the Keycloak server is over HTTPS. In production this should be set to all.
 This is OPTIONAL. The default value is external meaning that HTTPS is required by default for external requests.
 Valid values are 'all', 'external' and 'none'

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.confidential-port
properties.description: The confidential port used by the Keycloak server for secure connections over SSL/TLS

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.use-resource-role-mappings
properties.description:
If set to true, the adapter will look inside the token for application level role mappings for the user.
 If false, it will look at the realm level for user role mappings

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.enable-cors
properties.description:
This enables CORS support. It will handle CORS preflight requests. It will also look into the access token to
 determine valid origins

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.cors-max-age
properties.description:
If CORS is enabled, this sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age header. This is OPTIONAL. If not set,
 this header is not returned in CORS responses

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.cors-allowed-headers
properties.description:
If CORS is enabled, this sets the value of the Access-Control-Allow-Headers header. This should be a comma-separated
 string

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.cors-allowed-methods
properties.description:
If CORS is enabled, this sets the value of the Access-Control-Allow-Methods header. This should be a comma-separated
 string

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.cors-exposed-headers
properties.description:
If CORS is enabled, this sets the value of the Access-Control-Expose-Headers header. This should be a comma-separated
 string

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.bearer-only
properties.description:
This should be set to true for services. If enabled the adapter will not attempt to authenticate users,
 but only verify bearer tokens

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.autodetect-bearer-only
properties.description:
This should be set to true if your application serves both a web application and web services (e.g. SOAP or REST).
 It allows you to redirect unauthenticated users of the web application to the Keycloak login page, but send an HTTP 401
 status code to unauthenticated SOAP or REST clients instead as they would not understand a redirect to the login page.
 Keycloak auto-detects SOAP or REST clients based on typical headers like X-Requested-With, SOAPAction or Accept

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.public-client
properties.description: If this application is a public client

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.credentials.secret
properties.description: The client secret

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.credentials.jwt.{*}
properties.description: The settings for client authentication with signed JWT

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.credentials.secret-jwt.{*}
properties.description: The settings for client authentication with JWT using client secret

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.allow-any-hostname
properties.description:
If the Keycloak server requires HTTPS and this config option is set to true the Keycloak server??s certificate is
 validated via the truststore, but host name validation is not done. This setting should only be used during development
 and never in production as it will disable verification of SSL certificates. This seting may be useful in test
 environments

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.disable-trust-manager
properties.description:
If the Keycloak server requires HTTPS and this config option is set to true you do not have to specify a truststore.
 This setting should only be used during development and never in production as it will disable verification
 of SSL certificates

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.always-refresh-token
properties.description: If the adapter should refresh the access token for each request

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.truststore
properties.description:
The value is the file path to a keystore file. If you prefix the path with classpath:, then the truststore will be
 obtained from the deployment??s classpath instead. Used for outgoing HTTPS communications to the Keycloak server

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.truststore-password
properties.description: Password for the truststore keystore

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.client-keystore
properties.description:
This is the file path to a keystore file. This keystore contains client certificate for two-way SSL when the adapter
 makes HTTPS requests to the Keycloak server

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.client-keystore-password
properties.description: Password for the client keystore

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.client-key-password
properties.description: Password for the client??s key

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.connection-pool-size
properties.description:
Adapters will make separate HTTP invocations to the Keycloak server to turn an access code into an access token.
 This config option defines how many connections to the Keycloak server should be pooled

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.register-node-at-startup
properties.description:
If true, then adapter will send registration request to Keycloak. It??s false by default and useful only when application
 is clustered

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.register-node-period
properties.description: Period for re-registration adapter to Keycloak. Useful when application is clustered

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.token-store
properties.description:
Possible values are session and cookie. Default is session, which means that adapter stores account info in HTTP Session.
 Alternative cookie means storage of info in cookie

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.adapter-state-cookie-path
properties.description:
When using a cookie store, this option sets the path of the cookie used to store account info. If it??s a relative path,
 then it is assumed that the application is running in a context root, and is interpreted relative to that context root.
 If it??s an absolute path, then the absolute path is used to set the cookie path. Defaults to use paths relative to the
 context root

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.principal-attribute
properties.description:
OpenID Connect ID Token attribute to populate the UserPrincipal name with. If token attribute is null. Possible values
 are sub, preferred_username, email, name, nickname, given_name, family_name

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.turn-off-change-session-id-on-login
properties.description:
The session id is changed by default on a successful login on some platforms to plug a security attack vector.
 Change this to true if you want to turn this off

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.token-minimum-time-to-live
properties.description:
Amount of time, in seconds, to preemptively refresh an active access token with the Keycloak server before it expires.
 This is especially useful when the access token is sent to another REST client where it could expire before being
 evaluated. This value should never exceed the realm??s access token lifespan

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.min-time-between-jwks-requests
properties.description:
Amount of time, in seconds, specifying minimum interval between two requests to Keycloak to retrieve new public keys.
 It is 10 seconds by default. Adapter will always try to download new public key when it recognize token with unknown kid.
 However it won??t try it more than once per 10 seconds (by default). This is to avoid DoS when attacker sends lots of
 tokens with bad kid forcing adapter to send lots of requests to Keycloak

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.public-key-cache-ttl
properties.description:
Amount of time, in seconds, specifying maximum interval between two requests to Keycloak to retrieve new public keys.
 It is 86400 seconds (1 day) by default. Adapter will always try to download new public key when it recognize token
 with unknown kid . If it recognize token with known kid, it will just use the public key downloaded previously.
 However at least once per this configured interval (1 day by default) will be new public key always downloaded even if
 the kid of token is already known

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.verify-token-audience
properties.description:
If set to true, then during authentication with the bearer token, the adapter will verify whether the token contains
 this client name (resource) as an audience. The option is especially useful for services, which primarily serve
 requests authenticated by the bearer token. This is set to false by default, however for improved security, it is
 recommended to enable this. See Audience Support for more details about audience support

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.ignore-oauth-query-parameter
properties.description:
If set to true will turn off processing of the access_token query parameter for bearer token processing.
 Users will not be able to authenticate if they only pass in an access_token

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.proxy-url
properties.description: The proxy url to use for requests to the auth-server.

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.redirect-rewrite-rules.{*}
properties.description:
If needed, specify the Redirect URI rewrite rule. This is an object notation where the key is the regular expression to
 which the Redirect URI is to be matched and the value is the replacement String. $ character can be used for
 backreferences in the replacement String

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.enable
properties.description: Specifies how policies are enforced.

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.enforcement-mode
properties.description: Specifies how policies are enforced.

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.paths.{*}.name
properties.description: The name of a resource on the server that is to be associated with a given path

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.paths.{*}.path
properties.description: A URI relative to the application??s context path that should be protected by the policy enforcer

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.paths.{*}.methods.{*}.method
properties.description: The name of the HTTP method

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.paths.{*}.methods.{*}.scopes
properties.description: An array of strings with the scopes associated with the method

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.paths.{*}.methods.{*}.scopes-enforcement-mode
properties.description: A string referencing the enforcement mode for the scopes associated with a method

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.paths.{*}.enforcement-mode
properties.description: Specifies how policies are enforced

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.path-cache.max-entries
properties.description: Defines the time in milliseconds when the entry should be expired

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.path-cache.lifespan
properties.description: Defines the limit of entries that should be kept in the cache

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.lazy-load-paths
properties.description:
Specifies how the adapter should fetch the server for resources associated with paths in your application. If true,
 the
 policy
 enforcer is going to fetch resources on-demand accordingly with the path being requested

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.on-deny-redirect-to
properties.description:
Defines a URL where a client request is redirected when an "access denied" message is obtained from the server.
 By default, the adapter responds with a 403 HTTP status code

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.user-managed-access
properties.description: Specifies that the adapter uses the UMA protocol.

properties.name: quarkus.keycloak.policy-enforcer.http-method-as-scope
properties.description:
Specifies how scopes should be mapped to HTTP methods. If set to true, the policy enforcer will use the HTTP method
 from
 the current request to check whether or not access should be granted

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.trust-certs
properties.description: Whether or not the client should trust a self signed certificate if so presented by the API server

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.master-url
properties.description: URL of the Kubernetes API server

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.namespace
properties.description: Default namespace to use

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.ca-cert-file
properties.description: CA certificate file

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.ca-cert-data
properties.description: CA certificate data

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.client-cert-file
properties.description: Client certificate file

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.client-cert-data
properties.description: Client certificate data

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.client-key-file
properties.description: Client key file

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.client-key-data
properties.description: Client key data

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.client-key-algo
properties.description: Client key algorithm

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.client-key-passphrase
properties.description: Client key passphrase

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.username
properties.description: Kubernetes auth username

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.password
properties.description: Kubernetes auth password

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.watch-reconnect-interval
properties.description: Watch reconnect interval

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.watch-reconnect-limit
properties.description:
Maximum reconnect attempts in case of watch failure
 By default there is no limit to the number of reconnect attempts

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.connection-timeout
properties.description: Maximum amount of time to wait for a connection with the API server to be established

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.request-timeout
properties.description: Maximum amount of time to wait for a request to the API server to be completed

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.rolling-timeout
properties.description: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a rollout to be completed

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.http-proxy
properties.description: HTTP proxy used to access the Kubernetes API server

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.https-proxy
properties.description: HTTPS proxy used to access the Kubernetes API server

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.proxy-username
properties.description: Proxy username

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.proxy-password
properties.description: Proxy password

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes-client.no-proxy
properties.description: IP addresses or hosts to exclude from proxying

properties.name: quarkus.kubernetes.group
properties.description:
The group of the application.
 This value will be use as:
 - docker image repo
 - labeling resources

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.connection-string
properties.description:
Configures the connection string. The format is: {@code mongodb://[username:password@]host1[:port1][,host2[:port2],...[,hostN[:portN]]][/[database.collection][?options]]}

{@code mongodb://} is a required prefix to identify that this is a string in the standard connection format.

{@code username:password@} are optional. If given, the driver will attempt to login to a database after connecting to a database server. For some authentication mechanisms, only the username is specified and the password is not, in which case the ":" after the username is left off as well.

{@code host1} is the only required part of the connection string. It identifies a server address to connect to.

{@code :portX} is optional and defaults to :27017 if not provided.

{@code /database} is the name of the database to login to and thus is only relevant if the {@code username:password@} syntax is used. If not specified the {@code admin} database will be used by default.

{@code ?options} are connection options. Note that if {@code database} is absent there is still a {@code /} required between the last host and the {@code ?} introducing the options. Options are name=value pairs and the pairs are separated by "&".

An alternative format, using the {@code mongodb+srv} protocol, is: 

  mongodb+srv://[username:password@]host[/[database][?options]]
  • {@code mongodb+srv://} is a required prefix for this format.
  • {@code username:password@} are optional. If given, the driver will attempt to login to a database after connecting to a database server. For some authentication mechanisms, only the username is specified and the password is not, in which case the ":" after the username is left off as well
  • {@code host} is the only required part of the URI. It identifies a single host name for which SRV records are looked up from a Domain Name Server after prefixing the host name with {@code "_mongodb._tcp"}. The host/port for each SRV record becomes the seed list used to connect, as if each one were provided as host/port pair in a URI using the normal mongodb protocol.
  • {@code /database} is the name of the database to login to and thus is only relevant if the {@code username:password@} syntax is used. If not specified the "admin" database will be used by default.
  • {@code ?options} are connection options. Note that if {@code database} is absent there is still a {@code /} required between the last host and the {@code ?} introducing the options. Options are name=value pairs and the pairs are separated by "&". Additionally with the mongodb+srv protocol, TXT records are looked up from a Domain Name Server for the given host, and the text value of each one is prepended to any options on the URI itself. Because the last specified value for any option wins, that means that options provided on the URI will override any that are provided via TXT records.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.hosts
properties.description:
Configures the Mongo server addressed (one if single mode).
 The addressed are passed as {@code host:port}.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.database
properties.description: Configure the database name.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.application-name
properties.description: Configures the application name.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.max-pool-size
properties.description: Configures the maximum number of connections in the connection pool.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.min-pool-size
properties.description: Configures the minimum number of connections in the connection pool.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.max-connection-idle-time
properties.description: Maximum idle time of a pooled connection. A connection that exceeds this limit will be closed.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.max-connection-life-time
properties.description: Maximum life time of a pooled connection. A connection that exceeds this limit will be closed.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.wait-queue-timeout
properties.description: The maximum wait time that a thread may wait for a connection to become available.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.maintenance-frequency
properties.description: Configures the time period between runs of the maintenance job.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.maintenance-initial-delay
properties.description: Configures period of time to wait before running the first maintenance job on the connection pool.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.wait-queue-multiple
properties.description:
This multiplier, multiplied with the {@code maxPoolSize} setting, gives the maximum number of
 threads that may be waiting for a connection to become available from the pool. All further threads will get an
 exception right away.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.connect-timeout
properties.description: How long a connection can take to be opened before timing out.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.socket-timeout
properties.description: How long a send or receive on a socket can take before timing out.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.tls-insecure
properties.description: If connecting with TLS, this option enables insecure TLS connections.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.tls
properties.description: Whether to connect using TLS.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.replica-set-name
properties.description: Implies that the hosts given are a seed list, and the driver will attempt to find all members of the set.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.server-selection-timeout
properties.description: How long the driver will wait for server selection to succeed before throwing an exception.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.local-threshold
properties.description:
When choosing among multiple MongoDB servers to send a request, the driver will only send that request to a
 server whose ping time is less than or equal to the server with the fastest ping time plus the local threshold.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.heartbeat-frequency
properties.description: The frequency that the driver will attempt to determine the current state of each server in the cluster.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.write-concern.safe
properties.description:
Configures the safety.
 If set to {@code true}: the driver ensures that all writes are acknowledged by the MongoDB server, or else
 throws an exception. (see also {@code w} and {@code wtimeoutMS}).
 If set fo
 <li>{@code false}: the driver does not ensure that all writes are acknowledged by the MongoDB server.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.write-concern.journal
properties.description:
Configures the journal writing aspect.
 If set to {@code true}: the driver waits for the server to group commit to the journal file on disk.
 If set to {@code false}: the driver does not wait for the server to group commit to the journal file on disk.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.write-concern.w
properties.description:
When set, the driver adds {@code w: wValue} to all write commands. It requires {@code safe} to be {@code true}.
 The value is typically a number, but can also be the {@code majority} string.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.write-concern.retry-writes
properties.description: If set to {@code true}, the driver will retry supported write operations if they fail due to a network error.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.write-concern.w-timeout
properties.description:
When set, the driver adds {@code wtimeout : ms } to all write commands. It requires {@code safe} to be
 {@code true}.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.read-preference
properties.description:
Configures the read preferences.
 Supported values are: {@code primary|primaryPreferred|secondary|secondaryPreferred|nearest}

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.credentials.username
properties.description: Configures the username.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.credentials.password
properties.description: Configures the password.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.credentials.auth-mechanism
properties.description:
Configures the authentication mechanism to use if a credential was supplied.
 The default is unspecified, in which case the client will pick the most secure mechanism available based on the
 sever version. For the GSSAPI and MONGODB-X509 mechanisms, no password is accepted, only the username.
 Supported values: {@code MONGO-CR|GSSAPI|PLAIN|MONGODB-X509}

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.credentials.auth-source
properties.description:
Configures the source of the authentication credentials.
 This is typically the database that the credentials have been created. The value defaults to the database
 specified in the path portion of the connection string or in the 'database' configuration property..
 If the database is specified in neither place, the default value is {@code admin}. This option is only
 respected when using the MONGO-CR mechanism (the default).

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.credentials.auth-mechanism-properties.{*}
properties.description: Allows passing authentication mechanism properties.

properties.name: quarkus.mongodb.max-wait-queue-size
properties.description:
Configures the maximum number of concurrent operations allowed to wait for a server to become available.
 All further operations will get an exception immediately.

properties.name: quarkus.transaction-manager.node-name
properties.description: The node name used by the transaction manager

properties.name: quarkus.transaction-manager.xa-node-name
properties.description: The XA node name used by the transaction manager

properties.name: quarkus.transaction-manager.default-transaction-timeout
properties.description: The default transaction timeout

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.from
properties.description:
Configure the default `from` attribute.
 It's the sender email address.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.mock
properties.description:
Enables the mock mode, not sending emails. The content of the emails is printed on the console.

Disabled by default on PROD, enabled by default on DEV and TEST modes.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.bounce-address
properties.description: Configures the default bounce email address.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.host
properties.description: The SMTP host name.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.port
properties.description: The SMTP port.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.username
properties.description: The username.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.password
properties.description: The password.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.ssl
properties.description:
Enables or disables the SSL on connect.
 {@code false} by default.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.trust-all
properties.description:
Set whether to trust all certificates on ssl connect the option is also
 applied to {@code STARTTLS} operation. {@code false} by default.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.max-pool-size
properties.description:
Configures the maximum allowed number of open connections to the mail server
 If not set the default is {@code 10}.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.own-host-name
properties.description: The hostname to be used for HELO/EHLO and the Message-ID

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.keep-alive
properties.description:
Set if connection pool is enabled, {@code true} by default.

If the connection pooling is disabled, the max number of sockets is enforced nevertheless.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.disable-esmtp
properties.description: Disable ESMTP. {@code false} by default. The RFC-1869 states that clients should always attempt {@code EHLO} as first command to determine if ESMTP is supported, if this returns an error code, {@code HELO} is tried to use the regular SMTP command.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.start-tls
properties.description:
Set the TLS security mode for the connection.
 Either {@code NONE}, {@code OPTIONAL} or {@code REQUIRED}.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.login
properties.description:
Set the login mode for the connection.
 Either {@code DISABLED}, @{code OPTIONAL} or {@code REQUIRED}

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.auth-methods
properties.description:
Set the allowed auth methods.
 If defined, only these methods will be used, if the server supports them.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.key-store
properties.description: Set the key store.

properties.name: quarkus.mailer.key-store-password
properties.description: Set the key store password.

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.url
properties.description: The datasource URL.

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.username
properties.description: The datasource username.

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.password
properties.description: The datasource password.

properties.name: quarkus.datasource.max-size
properties.description: The datasource pool maximum size.

properties.name: quarkus.reactive-pg-client.cache-prepared-statements
properties.description: Whether prepared statements should be cached on the client side.

properties.name: quarkus.reactive-pg-client.pipelining-limit
properties.description: The maximum number of inflight database commands that can be pipelined.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.uri
properties.description: The uri this driver should connect to. The driver supports bolt, bolt+routing or neo4j as schemes.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.authentication.username
properties.description: The login of the user connecting to the database.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.authentication.password
properties.description: The password of the user connecting to the database.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.authentication.disabled
properties.description: Set this to true to disable authentication.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.pool.metrics-enabled
properties.description: Flag, if metrics are enabled.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.pool.log-leaked-sessions
properties.description: Flag, if leaked sessions logging is enabled.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.pool.max-connection-pool-size
properties.description: The maximum amount of connections in the connection pool towards a single database.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.pool.idle-time-before-connection-test
properties.description:
Pooled connections that have been idle in the pool for longer than this timeout will be tested before they are used
 again. The value {@literal 0} means connections will always be tested for validity and negative values mean
 connections
 will never be tested.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.pool.max-connection-lifetime
properties.description: Pooled connections older than this threshold will be closed and removed from the pool.

properties.name: quarkus.neo4j.pool.connection-acquisition-timeout
properties.description: Acquisition of new connections will be attempted for at most configured timeout.

properties.name: quarkus.resteasy.singleton-resources
properties.description:
If this is true then JAX-RS will use only a single instance of a resource class to service all requests.

If this is false then it will create a new instance of the resource per request.

If the resource class has an explicit CDI scope annotation then the value of this annotation will always be used to control the lifecycle of the resource class.

IMPLEMENTATION NOTE: {@code javax.ws.rs.Path} turns into a CDI stereotype with singleton scope. As a result, if a user annotates a JAX-RS resource with a stereotype which has a different default scope the deployment fails with IllegalStateException.

properties.name: quarkus.resteasy.path
properties.description:
Set this to override the default path for JAX-RS resources if there are no
 annotated application classes.

properties.name: quarkus.resteasy.gzip.enabled
properties.description: If gzip is enabled

properties.name: quarkus.resteasy.gzip.max-input
properties.description:
Maximum deflated file bytes size

If the limit is exceeded, Resteasy will return Response with status 413("Request Entity Too Large")

properties.name: quarkus.smallrye-health.root-path
properties.description: Root path for health-checking servlets.

properties.name: quarkus.smallrye-health.liveness-path
properties.description: The relative path of the liveness health-checking servlet.

properties.name: quarkus.smallrye-health.readiness-path
properties.description: The relative path of the readiness health-checking servlet.

properties.name: quarkus.smallrye-jwt.auth-mechanism
properties.description: The authentication mechanism

properties.name: quarkus.smallrye-jwt.realm-name
properties.description: The authentication mechanism

properties.name: quarkus.smallrye-jwt.enabled
properties.description: The MP-JWT configuration object

properties.name: quarkus.smallrye-jwt.rsa-sig-provider
properties.description: The name of the {@linkplain java.security.Provider} that supports SHA256withRSA signatures

properties.name: quarkus.swagger-ui.path
properties.description: The path of the swagger-ui servlet.

properties.name: quarkus.swagger-ui.always-include
properties.description:
If this should be included every time. By default this is only included when the application is running
 in dev mode.

properties.name: quarkus.smallrye-metrics.path
properties.description: The path to the metrics Servlet.

properties.name: quarkus.tika.tika-config-path
properties.description: The path to the tika-config.xml

properties.name: quarkus.tika.append-embedded-content
properties.description:
Controls how the content of the embedded documents is parsed.
 By default it is appended to the master document content.
 Setting this property to false makes the content of each of the embedded documents
 available separately.

properties.name: quarkus.servlet.context-path
properties.description:
The context path to serve all Servlet context from. This will also affect any resources
 that run as a Servlet, e.g. JAX-RS

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.caching
properties.description: Enables or disables the Vert.x cache.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.classpath-resolving
properties.description: Enables or disabled the Vert.x classpath resource resolver.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.event-loops-pool-size
properties.description: The number of event loops. 2 x the number of core by default.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.max-event-loop-execute-time
properties.description: The maximum amount of time the event loop can be blocked.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.warning-exception-time
properties.description: The amount of time before a warning is displayed if the event loop is blocked.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.worker-pool-size
properties.description: The size of the worker thread pool.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.max-worker-execute-time
properties.description: The maximum amount of time the worker thread can be blocked.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.internal-blocking-pool-size
properties.description: The size of the internal thread pool (used for the file system).

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.use-async-dns
properties.description: Enables the async DNS resolver.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.key-certificate-pem.keys
properties.description: Comma-separated list of the path to the key files (Pem format).

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.key-certificate-pem.certs
properties.description: Comma-separated list of the path to the certificate files (Pem format).

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.key-certificate-jks.path
properties.description: Path of the key file (JKS format).

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.key-certificate-jks.password
properties.description: Password of the key file.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.key-certificate-pfx.path
properties.description: Path to the key file (PFX format)

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.key-certificate-pfx.password
properties.description: Password of the key.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.trust-certificate-pem.certs
properties.description: Comma-separated list of the trust certificate files (Pem format).

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.trust-certificate-jks.path
properties.description: Path of the key file (JKS format).

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.trust-certificate-jks.password
properties.description: Password of the key file.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.trust-certificate-pfx.path
properties.description: Path to the key file (PFX format)

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.trust-certificate-pfx.password
properties.description: Password of the key.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.accept-backlog
properties.description: The accept backlog.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.client-auth
properties.description: The client authentication.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.connect-timeout
properties.description: The connect timeout.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.idle-timeout
properties.description: The idle timeout in milliseconds.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.receive-buffer-size
properties.description: The receive buffer size.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.reconnect-attempts
properties.description: The number of reconnection attempts.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.reconnect-interval
properties.description: The reconnection interval in milliseconds.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.reuse-address
properties.description: Whether or not to reuse the address.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.reuse-port
properties.description: Whether or not to reuse the port.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.send-buffer-size
properties.description: The send buffer size.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.soLinger
properties.description: The so linger.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.ssl
properties.description: Enables or Disabled SSL.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.tcp-keep-alive
properties.description: Whether or not to keep the TCP connection opened (keep-alive).

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.tcp-no-delay
properties.description: Configure the TCP no delay.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.traffic-class
properties.description: Configure the traffic class.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.eventbus.trust-all
properties.description: Enables or disables the trust all parameter.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.cluster.host
properties.description: The host name.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.cluster.port
properties.description: The port.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.cluster.public-host
properties.description: The public host name.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.cluster.public-port
properties.description: The public port.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.cluster.clustered
properties.description: Enables or disables the clustering.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.cluster.ping-interval
properties.description: The ping interval.

properties.name: quarkus.vertx.cluster.ping-reply-interval
properties.description: The ping reply interval.

properties.name: quarkus.http.cors
properties.description: Enable the CORS filter.

properties.name: quarkus.http.port
properties.description: The HTTP port

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl-port
properties.description: The HTTPS port

properties.name: quarkus.http.test-port
properties.description: The HTTP port used to run tests

properties.name: quarkus.http.test-ssl-port
properties.description: The HTTPS port used to run tests

properties.name: quarkus.http.host
properties.description: The HTTP host

properties.name: quarkus.http.io-threads
properties.description:
The number if IO threads used to perform IO. This will be automatically set to a reasonable value based on
 the number of CPU cores if it is not provided

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.certificate.file
properties.description: The file path to a server certificate or certificate chain in PEM format.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.certificate.key-file
properties.description: The file path to the corresponding certificate private key file in PEM format.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.certificate.key-store-file
properties.description: An optional key store which holds the certificate information instead of specifying separate files.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.certificate.key-store-file-type
properties.description:
An optional parameter to specify type of the key store file. If not given, the type is automatically detected
 based on the file name.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.certificate.key-store-password
properties.description: A parameter to specify the password of the key store file. If not given, the default ("password") is used.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.cipher-suites
properties.description: The cipher suites to use. If none is given, a reasonable default is selected.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.protocols
properties.description: The list of protocols to explicitly enable.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.provider-name
properties.description: The SSL provider name to use. If none is given, the platform default is used.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.session-cache-size
properties.description: The SSL session cache size. If not given, the platform default is used.

properties.name: quarkus.http.ssl.session-timeout
properties.description: The SSL session cache timeout. If not given, the platform default is used.

properties.name: quarkus.http.cors.origins
properties.description:
Origins allowed for CORS

 Comma separated list of valid URLs. ex: http://www.quarkus.io,http://localhost:3000
 The filter allows any origin if this is not set.

 default: returns any requested origin as valid

properties.name: quarkus.http.cors.methods
properties.description:
HTTP methods allowed for CORS

 Comma separated list of valid methods. ex: GET,PUT,POST
 The filter allows any method if this is not set.

 default: returns any requested method as valid

properties.name: quarkus.http.cors.headers
properties.description:
HTTP headers allowed for CORS

 Comma separated list of valid headers. ex: X-Custom,Content-Disposition
 The filter allows any header if this is not set.

 default: returns any requested header as valid

properties.name: quarkus.http.cors.exposed-headers
properties.description:
HTTP headers exposed in CORS

 Comma separated list of valid headers. ex: X-Custom,Content-Disposition
 
 default: <empty>
